meanings.definition: To look at or observe closely
meanings.sent1: She eyeballed the tiny ant crawling on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The detective eyeballed the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat eyeballed the colorful butterfly fluttering by.
meanings.sent4: The artist eyeballed the proportions of the portrait before starting to paint.
meanings.sent5: He eyeballed the intricate details of the map to find the hidden treasure.

meanings.sent3: The chef eyeballed the amount of spices to add to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: She eyeballed the size of the room to determine how much furniture would fit.
meanings.sent5: The tailor eyeballed the customer's measurements for the perfect fit.
